Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position!!!!”
Reviews.Author: relax80
Reviews.Content: We spent our vacation in Barcelona here close to the main attractions in the centre of the city; it is a nice place with all amenities for a short stay,near Ramblas and Metro (liceu and catalunya). Nice and gentle staff and good breakfast in the front,in the Hotel Cortes. The only remarkable defect is the not good smell in the bedroom sometimes in the evening, but right for a couple that would like to visit Barcelona in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: igortudor5 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central position near to the Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, you can visit all the city starting from there easily. The hotel is clean, simple but you have everything you need...tv, wifi, minibar empty for keeping what you want inside, 2 pc to use free at first floor with coffe and drinks machine(by coins). The breakfast is in the bar in front of the hotel, they give you a coupon to give to the waiters... The breakfast is simple but enough to begin your day(2 pastries, one bread roll. ham and cheese, ham and butter, orange juice and hot drink all served at the table. The staff of the hotel is very helpful and very kind. And the hotel is not very expensive. My opinion is very good about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TangoTommy
Reviews.Content: Went to this Hotel from 17th to the 20th February 2010. The hotel is situated just of la Rambla in a quiet little street with a restaurant directly opposite and bar and eating facilities in the hotel. Being on the 4th floor was no problem, the lift being very efficient. Rooms were immaculate and the bathroom just as equally impressive. Rooms have stocked fridge (pretty expensive) and free safe. Hairdryer in bathroom which has two wall to wall mirrors. Towels replaced every day. Supermarket is 20 feet from the hotel and the smallest pub you have ever been in is at the side of the hotel. Prices are 2 euros a ber, where in the other local establishments you are paying on average 4.80 to 5.80 euros a beer. Among othe attractions, a must visit is the massive fruit market on the left hand side of La Rambla as you are looking from the harbour about 800yards in. Another must visit is Flahertys Irish pub (if you can find it) which sells the best steak and Guinness pie ever. If you are thinking of taking in a game at the Nou camp do not buy you tickets online or off any the vendors selling them. Go straight to the ticket office at the ground (55 to 67 euros) early morning to avoid the queues and you will get tickets at half the price of the other outlets(135 to 200 euros). In the La Rambla area beware the pickpockets. The plan is for an elderly lady to stumble in front of you. You go to help her. A girl comes over and says its her mother then the others come to help and your money is gone and believe me theses guys are exceptional. Also beware the prostitutes who will touch you all over to locate your money. They will not take no for an answer unless you show some aggression towards them. Try not to let this worry you as its a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Located a Dentist”
Reviews.Author: Mollie D
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful, easy to find, and last stop on airport bus - no guessing about where to get off. Room was clean, comfortable, and quiet at night. Wonderful street sounds in the day from the narrow little street in front of the hotel. On our last morning at 9:00, a crown came off my tooth at breakfast; we were to board a ship in the early afternoon. Shelia, at reception, located a dentist for us who would meet us at 11:30. The dentist arrived a few minutes early, replaced the crown with directions of "Don't eat on that side until evening." We were on our way to the cruise terminal at 12:00. Problem solved! Charge 100 euros, a very fair price for emergency Sunday service for a non regular patient. We would most certainly stay at Hotel Catalunya any time we are in Barcelona. THANK YOU, SHELIA!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent No Frills City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoelSuttonColdfield
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Location ideal and excellent vegetarian restaurant (I never thought I would say that)in the same street. Free internet & wi-fi too. Next time I return to Barcelona I will re-book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little city break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Riccardo24
Reviews.Content: Situated very close to the touristic center of Barcelona, everything you need is never more than a short walk away from the Old Town to the beach or the city bus tour it is all there. There is the market of souvenirs on las Ramblas or the quality shops around Catalunya Square. The hotel is small but nicely decorated and has a feel of quality. The staff were very helpful and for such a budget price offered 5 star service. The internet room was very useful. Because of its small size breakfast was available from a cafe opposite where the service was brusque to say the least and the food basic and poor compared to surrounding cafes. My advice is don't bother. But this is a small negative on an otherwise excellent little Hotel. I would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely home base for Barcelona visit.”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Catalunya. It was clean, comfortable and secure. The staff spoke English well and were very helpful in providing information on sights, transportation and restaurants. While we were there the weather was very hot and kind of rainy. Our room was lovely with the windows open and cool and comfortable when we had to close the windows for rain. The computer room and wi fi were both helpful to us in arranging expeditions and contacting home. The hotel is just a block off La Rabla with lots of pedestrian traffic out front, yet with the windows closed it is completely quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: tract13
Reviews.Content: Basic accommodation, nevertheless, it was very clean; manned by friendly staff and nice & cool in the 30 degree Barcelona heat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible if you need to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Mayabue
Reviews.Content: It's decent and very clean. Rooms are very small and can get uncomfortable with two people, and while showers have good pressure, you spray the whole bathroom... The gym is a bit of a joke, but it has a nice turkish pool. Supposedly there is a working spa. The business center is their fortee. However, if you are here for business and need a good night's sleep, and are a light sleeper, good luck. All floors are marble! There is no carpeting. You hear every step in the hallway and room above you. ..every door closed, every suitcase dragged. So, while it might be a good value for the money, if you are a light sleeper, it will be the worst choice you could make. It baffles me that hoteliers do not consider the quality of sleep they should afford their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: cristina_koen
Reviews.Content: Bad experience that consisted of the hotel staff charging me and my grandmother for two double rooms instead of one. Why? A computer mistake that they blamed on us, and proceeded to tell us that "there was nothing they could do" and that "only 'the boss' could fix it", nevertheless, they had charged us for 2 rooms and only gave us the key to one room, the one we used, highly convenient of them. During our brief 24 stay, we talked to 3 staff members about our problem, and even waited the whole morning for a seemingly nonexistent "boss" to arrive. When we left, the charges were still in place and nobody even tried to help us/seemed to care. We were treated mostly as annoying pests rather than paying clients.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: annie7Huddersfield
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Hotel Cataluna. After reading a few reviews I was slightly anxious about what we may be sleeping in, but it was fine. Location was great. We took the Aerobus from the airport and it stopped in Plaza Catlunya. From there it was a five minute walk to the hotel. My map reading skills aren't great! It should have been two minutes!! The hotel is on Carrer Santa Anna which is a narrow street lined with shops, a couple of restaurants and bars. It leads directly on to La Ramblas at the far end. Check in was easy. There were two women on the reception -both spoke excellent English - although I do use basic Spanish, I didn't need to. We had paid in advance anyway, were given the keycard and the breakfast procedure was explained. So we went up to our room to unpack. There is a lift - we didn't use it on the first trip up to floor 3, but the stairs were quite steep so we became lazy and used the lift afterwards. We were on the third floor - room 307, overlooked Carrer Santa Anna, which was at times quite noisy, but hey - we were in the city centre. the room was quite small, but big enough for us. The sheets and towels were spotless. The bathroom was small but fine - a few toiletries were provided, lots of toilet roll. The cleaners came in on the second day and changed the towels and made the bed. Breakfast was at the bar/restaurant straight across the street. It was a pastry or two, bread roll and cheese/ham/meat, jam, butter etc. A glass of orange juice and coffee. Adequate as a start to the day. I would happily recommend this to a friend as a good value, centrally located hotel. If you are looking for a luxurious break then maybe think of somewhere more expensive, but if you are prepared to live for a couple of days in a clean, basic hotel then try this hotel. When I return to Barcelona I will probably consider staying at Hotel Catalunya again as the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: puddle1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge rip off. We paid the equivalent of 100 pounds a night for a very uncomfortable room with no carpet (or any kind of decent flooring), beds with mattresses which seemed to be designed with the sole purpose of PREVENTING sleep with a really wierd hard lump which was supposed to be a pillow. We had no sleep for the four nights we were there. The hotel is very, very noisy- not only due to various things going on outside the hotel late at night and at the crack of dawn but also because there is absolutely ZERO sound proofing and you will hear EVERYTHING through the flimsy walls. At around 7 in the morning you will be woken up with the sound of the wheely beds screetching across the tiled floors in the rooms above you. The staff are generally hostile towards non- spanish travellers and tend to welcome you with glares when you come in through the entrance door. The breakfast and internet were free but both services left a lot to be desired. At this price you could really do better!!! Me and my mum actually ended up leaving this horrible place on our fourth night (we had intended to stay a week) and moved to a different hotel. This cost us another 200 pounds, but we were that desperate we decided we had to. Hotel Cataluna offers no refunds so we lost out on about 300 pounds. We moved to a four star hotel (not our usual practice) which was less than 100 a night for a beautiful room, no noise and comfortable beds!! Staying here ruined our trip. I don't think this is a place suitable for families visiting Spain from other countries. Please consider it carefully, because we didn't! The location was the only good thing, and we were too tired and fed up to even enjoy it!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: pbaoa
Reviews.Content: We began by being greeted by an old man only speaking spanish who was constanbtly shouting and grabbing my arms, check in took quite a long time. we were forced into a tiny lift with our suitcases and the old man was shouting still. When we ghot to our rooms the air conditioning had not been turned on and we were boiling. When we did turn it on it was very noisy. The bed sheets where extremelly stale and uncomfortable and when we checked them, they actually had pubic hair in them. I threw out the pyjamas i had worn in the bed. It got worse, within 20 minutes of arrival the wardrobe door fell of and almost badly hurt one of us, this was not the only thing to break. When in the bath, the shower curtain repeatedly fell down, the same thing happened in my daughters room. The walls were paper thin and i could hear everything that was said in the next room. To see a veiw of La Rambles I had to stand on my toes and strain to see out of the window (which was covered in cigarettes). Check took twice as long as check in and once again, we were bothered by the old man who worked there. Everyone stay away from here, thankfully i only had to stay one night, however if i had booked longer, i would have cancelled and found somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: UllaCph
Reviews.Content: Great location. The room was very clean and it was nice to have a refrigerator. Free Internet. Very close to The Rambla and Plaza Catalunya with all kinds of public transport including Aerobus to and from the airport. Disliked: Very bad lighting in the room. We were almost unable to read in spite of the bedside lamps. We had payed for a "Superior Room", but it did not seem superior at all and we had to pay extra for using the safety box at the room. The coffee machine at the first floor was out of order all the time. Breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous Customer Service- avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: MRYANIreland
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend to NOT stay in this hotel. We were completely ripped off by the staff and attempting to rectify the situation, the staff were rude and completely unaccomodating. We were overcharged, given tiny rooms with no window to the outside and rooms with beds cramped in that should not have beeen there. The location is great if you don't mind the noise at night and for that reason I would recommend Hotel Nouval only a few doors down. 2 members of your group stayed there and had very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lia747mnl
Reviews.Content: A nice basic hotel in a great location. Took the Aerobus (5 euros) from the airport to Placa Catalunya and walked for about 2 minutes to the hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Internet access is free. Maybe a bit noisy at times because of its location. Breakfast comes with 3 rolls/pastries, an orange juice, and coffee. It was served at the restaurant across the hotel. It's a no frills hotel and a perfect base for our shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vanda9
Reviews.Content: Really easy hotel to find just off La Ramblas, very safe area, and only 25 euros from the airport. Staff very helpful and 24 hour reception. We stayed two nights and although we had some very noisy neighbours the fist night had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms were basic but very clean and just what you need for a city break. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PMLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a fantastic location, very near Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. It is spacious and very clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Barcelona and wants to be within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and sightseeing attractions.

Reviews.Title: “OK For A Base”
Reviews.Author: garfthelarf
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated, its next door the the Nouvel Hotel which i stayed in March 2007 (which i never knew when i booked it !!!). Its just a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas & the main Cataluna Square where buses from the airport terminate. Small hotel but very very clean. Breakfast facilities are across the road in a small cafe. Its idea as a base if your just going to be using the hotel for sleeping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hotmel
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just off the top end of La Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya right in the heart of the city and many local attractions. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was powerful and cold, nothing like coming back to a cool room after a walk in the hot August Barcelona heat. Average bathroom .Facilities included TV, no minibar. The hotel did not have a breakfast room, breakfast vouchers were provided every morning and breakfast was served in a Café just across the hotel. The ‘tiny’ breakfast consisted of 3 pastries, coffee and juice. Refurbishment works were ongoing on the first floor and the lift was mostly out of order. This made the climb to our room on the third floor an uphill task indeed. Hotel staff were just doing their jobs and not very friendly. Great location to all major attractions on Las Ramblas and Catalunya metro station was a short walk away. Cortes ingles, the big Spanish department store was just round the corner. The Tourist information centre and the ‘ bus turistic ‘ stops were close by too. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to fellow travelers.
